summary:
There are lots and lots of printed books in the TES games but where do they come from?
Well at least here is a printing press now for you modders.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][size=3][b]None of these resources or parts of them may be used in paid mods[/b][/size][/color]

=============================
Stroti's Printing Press Resource for Skyrim

Version 1.0
=============================

by Stroti

Converted by Tamira

=============================

Modder's resource
=============================

This resource was originally published for Oblivion. You can find the original files here:
http://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/36064/?

=================

There are lots and lots of printed books in the TES games but where do they come from?
Well at least here is a printing press now for you modders.

Check out Antiscamp's blog for his WIP mod "Azura's Watch", he made already use of it:
http://frontierskyrim.wordpress.com/2014/11/06/the-gutenberg/

Note: The printing lead letters form Stroti's favorite saying :D


This resource was originally published for Oblivion. You can find the original files here:
http://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/36064/?


=================
Tools used:
=================

Nifskope
NifUtils by Skyfox

=================
Permissions:
=================

This is a modder's resource.You may use the meshes and textures for your own mods as long as you give credit to the authors and you do not charge money for it.

You may use this resource in Skyrim Special Edition too. All files should work without problems.

Do not upload to other sites.

Stroti has quit modding and will no longer be active on the forums.
I have his personal permission to convert his Oblivion resources and to upload them.

=================
Credits:
=================

Stroti for his resources and for everything he has given to the TES community
The Niftools team for giving us Nifskope.
Skyfox from the Niftools team for his great tool NifUtils
Bethesda for the TES games
author: Stroti and Tamira
